page.title: 09Energy
page.content: The main source of energy in our area is{coal},and electricity pylons cross the region as part of the National Grid Network.Most of the area has been converted to natural{gas}and there is an{oil}storage depot on a nearby industrial estate.Within our local environment we have Woolley Colliery coalmine,which has recently been enlarged to include a new washery and a coke preparation plant.At the present time 1,350 men work at Woolley and it has annual output of 400,000 tons of coal per year.Most of the coal goes to near by power stations such as Ferrybridge and some goes to coking plants.Approximately 60% of all domestic fuel in our area is natural gas however some outlying villages such as Cawthorne are only just being connected to the National Gas network.
